reviews.review_msg: definitely one of the most flakey profs ever. She doesn't let you know if she is going to ghost the WHOLE class she left for MONTHS without notice and didn't respond to emails. No idea of my standing in the class up until roughly last week. Super unprofessional and SFU is always promoting learning Indigneous knowledge.. hypocrisy..

Save yourself some sanity and don't take INDG 101 with this professor. Wait until you can get a better professor because this prof literally does NOT reply emails or grade assignments.

Sent an email over a month ago and she didn't reply. NONE of our assignments have been marked and it's already the end of the term. 

AND WHERE ARE THE TA'S???

As another review said, she's a nice person but a very disorganized and absent lecturer. She has multiple conflicting responsibilities so I understand to some degree how hard it must be to prioritize lecturing, but she basically makes us teach ourselves the course through weekly 1.5 hour long "presentations"

Year isn't finished yet but this is sort of ridiculous. I was really excited to learn, and incredibly disappointed to find out that we were teaching ourselves. It's either an absent prof missing a full month of lectures or having us do one and a half hour presentations to teach ourselves everytime. The assignments are also insanely unclear.

Prof was so disorganized, making continual errors in her own slides and in her feedback comments. She then changed and added to the grading criteria randomly throughout the course. Prepare for group projects where ur grade relies on other peoples writing ability and grasp of concepts. Not fair. Don't believe her syllabus, it will change! Good luck!
super nice person, not a great prof. everything was extremely disorganized and little to no explanation for anything was given. easier class for sure but be prepared to be confused

Learning material was interesting, but the way in which the professor made lessons extremely monotonous. Prof would take 3 hours to present 20 slides, relying on 1h+ videos to teach. Consistent spelling & grammatical errors in her slides and messages. Also, inconsistencies between most verbal instructions, criteria and guidelines given in messages.

Wasn't hard but the prof made it more challenging than it needed to be. Her instructions were SO unclear and she had spelling errors and mistakes throughout her slides and tests. She cancelled so many lectures so the class was very behind. We literally did the last unit of our class on the same day as the test and we had to take it right after.
She does not answer emails, She has several spelling errors throughout all her slides and canvas messages, and she contradicts her assignment instructions.

She is a wonderful person, but that is not to be confused with being a good teacher. She relies on online videos that are hours long to teach the content which was so boring and should not be used in university-level courses. It is not too hard to do well but it is mundane. I had to drag myself to attend. Did not answer emails too
